result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John K. Rammelt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #16CM19 and #16CM69 called at 11:54am. 
Defendant John K. Rammelt in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Case #16CM19 is scheduled for hearing on Pretrial Motions today, however the Defense submits paperwork for entry of changes in plea.
The Court finds there is victim rights compliance in both cases. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #2 of Case #16CM19; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 of Case #16CM19 and the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #16CM69.
On request of the Defense, the Court schedules Sentencing on a later date.
recess 12:00pm. 

NEXT:  Sentencing Hearing in Case #16CM19 on 
8/30/16 at 11:30am.  (JA- set read-in case #16CM69 onto the Court's calendar at this date/time for the Court's own review as part of the Sentencing in Case #16CM19)
Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant
Motion hearing on August 30, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Enclosure Letter received from State
State's
To Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications - State's
State's Response to Scheduling Order
Jury trial on September 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on September 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Scheduling Order

Cases 16CM19 & 16CM69 called together at 9:19 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant John K. Rammelt in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews that at scheduled time of hearing, off record DA Happ and the court discussed availability of ADA Teuber as Atty De La Rosa was not present and indicated to the Clerk that trial dates would be needed. 
DA Happ confirms this was conversation.
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that he is not available on 8/29/16 for FSSC, but can be available on 9/1/16 for trial - Court indicates that It can pick a different date for FSSC.
Clerk disributes scheduling order to Counsel
Recess: 9:23 am 

NEXT: 16CM19: (1) Schedule FSSC - 8/30/16 at 10:30 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 9/1/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
16CM69: (1) Schedule FSSC - 9/19/16 at 3:00 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 9/22/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on June 21, 2016 at 08:10 am.

Cases 16M19 & 16CM69 called together at 10:58 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant John K. Rammelt in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court so finds
Atty Hagemann requests that matter be set for additional STC, which will likely become plea/sentencing date. Know there is offer that Atty De La Rosa still needs to discuss with client
No objection from DA Happ
Court directs Clerk to schedule matter at 8:10 am so it can be set quickly
Recess: 11:00 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 6/21/16 at 8:10 am - Send notices
State's
Status conference on June 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2016 at 02:20 pm.

Case called at 2:29pm [mo]
Defendant John K. Rammelt in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
 
 Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no possession of drug paraphenallia
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 2:30pm


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/6/16 at 2:20pm   (2)  Status Conference on 6/7/16 at 10:30am
